articles.title: "Seven Lyra" Prize Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
"Seven Lyra" Prize Awarded to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- "Seven Lyra" Prize was awarded to leader Kim Jong Il at an inaugural ceremony of the "Seven Lyra" Music and Dance Olympics held in Budapest on Dec. 14.
 The prize was conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to the country by the founder of the "Seven Lyra" Music and Dance Olympics.    
 Written on the prize are words "'Seven Lyra' Prize for 2003. Tribute to the Korean Music and Dance Culture. 'Seven Lyra' Music and Dance Olympics".

Congratulations to Prime Minister of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Congratulations to Prime Minister of Uzbekistan
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Shavkat Mirziyaev upon his appointment as prime minister of Uzbekistan.
 The message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop and wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Film Show Held for Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Film Show Held for Foreign Diplomats
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps for economic and trade councillors corps here on December 24, the 12th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 86th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
 Present there were Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned.    
 The participants enjoyed the Korean documentary film "Bringing about a Great Turn with the Songun Revolutionary Leadership."

articles.title: Plan for Scientific Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
articles.content:
Plan for Scientific Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- A 2004-2005 plan for scientific cooperation was signed between academies of sciences of the DPRK and Mongolia in Ulan Bator on Dec. 19.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of a delegation of the Academy of Sciences led by Vice-President Pak Sung Chae from the DPRK side and Vice-President of the Mongolian Academy of Sciences T. Galbater and other officials concerned from the opposite side.
